content.description: Even shorter than Marthas Bunion! Start on the edge and go straight up. Should be topped out, but might need cleaned a little.
content.location: Far climber's right on the front wall. Just past the overhanging horn. Across from the downclimb of the Broken Boulder.

content.description: Start on the ledge under the overhang. Come out through some crimping, then work up the right side of the seam. Finish is up right.
content.location: Seam up the center of the Front Wall.

content.description: Start on the undercling rail in the roof, then work up the juggy pockets. The last two holds are a little crimpy, and it's a bit dynamic to the finish hold.
content.location: Just to the left of the arete on the Front Wall.

content.description: Start on edge far out right (same as Vegan Stout) and traverse your way left into the roof. Top out left of the tip of the horn. Downclimb through the hole.
content.protection: 2-3 pads would be ideal, but can be done with 1.
content.location: A giant horn jutting out of the Front Wall towards the right.

content.description: Big wall toward New Cross drive, a little West of the roadside parking spots. Out of the sun, so it gets a little grimy. You probably shouldn't try to top out. The landing zone is clear (if not a little muddy).
